title: Clean and Unclean Foods, Tithing
summary: Deuteronomy 14 outlines dietary laws for Godâ€™s holy people, listing clean and unclean animals. It also commands a tithe of produce to support Levites and the poor, encouraging generosity and worship.

faq.question: Why were dietary laws given?
faq.answer: To set Israel apart as holy and obedient to God.

faq.question: What was the purpose of the tithe?
faq.answer: To honor God, support the Levites, and care for the poor and needy.
